author: Rachael Pells
title: SATs tests face being scrapped for seven year olds
text:
Thursday 30 March 2017 11:36 BST Click to followThe Independent Online 
Controversial national tests taken by six and seven-year-olds in England could be scrapped under radical new government proposals. 
The move follows years of pressure from parents and industry leaders who argue the compulsory tests put children under too much stress at too young an age. 
The Department for Education is proposing a new assessment for pupils when they first start school instead.
